question.body: The ___________ are part of the central nervous system, while the peripheral nervous system mainly contains ___________?

response.feedback: Incorrect. The brain and spinal cord are not part of the peripheral nervous system.
Correct. The central nervous system is the control center and contains the brain and spinal cord.
Incorrect. Receptors are actually part of the peripheral nervous system.

part.hint: The central nervous system is the control or processing center for the nervous system.

question.body: The __________ division sends instructions from the brain while the ___________ division brings information from receptors to the brain.

response.feedback: Incorrect. Both the somatic and autonomic nervous systems can send instructions from the brain, the term somatic and autonomic tells what kind of effectors are stimulated.
Incorrect. The sensory division brings information to the brain
Correct. Motor always carries information away
Incorrect. While the autonomic is responsible for bringing information to effectors, it only carries information to involuntary structures.

part.hint: Sensory is sometimes known as afferent and motor is known as efferent.
